description: Covendos GmbH, founded in 2009, is a German company specializing in efficient healthcare communication solutions. They cater to the healthcare industry, including pharmaceuticals, medical technology, medical devices, veterinary medicine, clinics, dental practices, health centers, health insurance companies, nursing facilities, nutritional supplements, functional food, and wellness sectors. Covendos offers a range of services including remote services with "Pharmaberater im Innendienst" (in-house pharmaceutical consultants), medical information services, and remote training. Their offerings are structured around four business areas: Multi Channel Center (PBI-Teams, campaign teams, OTC telesales teams, customer care outsourcing), Sales Expert Unit (vacancy management, service teams, tandem teams), Smart Agency (classic advertising, digital marketing, POS & event), and Academy Plus (webinar training, digital change processes, content, format & channel). Covendos emphasizes bridging the gap between traditional sales and multi-channel go-to-market models. They highlight audited processes in data protection, reconciliation, drug safety, and pharmacovigilance. They operate medical information centers covering the DACH region, providing medical and scientific information to external and internal clients via phone, email, and post, including triage, handling adverse events, monitoring medication adherence, patient registration, and support. They also offer medical content and project management, research, review process support, module development for remote webinars, training materials, and quality control for sales teams. Covendos has approximately 110 employees and has generated 1.5 million multi-channel contacts.

The company has developed and marketed five products incorporating their patented cold plasma technology, selling over 35,000 units with partners. terraplasma's technology uses ambient air and electrical energy to generate cold plasma, which is effective against microorganisms and can be used in water treatment, the food industry, medicine, and cosmetics. description: RAPID Biomedical, founded in 1998 and located in Rimpar, Germany, specializes in the development and manufacturing of MR (Magnetic Resonance) coils for human and animal applications, serving both research and clinical needs. The company offers a wide range of customized and OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) coils, including volume resonators, surface coils, and phased arrays, operating from low field strengths up to 9.4 T UHF for human scanners and 21 T for pre-clinical scanners. Their product line includes non-proton solutions covering 11 different nuclei, compatibility with major MR systems, interventional head coils, and PET-compatible MR coils. They have delivered over 1200 different coil designs to more than 30 countries. RAPID Biomedical also holds FDA 510(k) clearance for Dual Tuned Head Coils 3T. The company emphasizes close collaborations with research institutes, resulting in scientific publications, and serves as a partner and supplier to OEMs. Their sister company, RAPID MR International, serves customers in the US, Canada, and South America. The company's philosophy centers on serving and supporting MR scientists with fair and honest relationships, and they are committed to maintaining high technical standards and providing reliable products.

description: PVT Plasma und Vakuum Technik GmbH, headquartered in Bensheim, Germany, is a company specializing in ion- and plasma-assisted vacuum coating technologies for over 30 years. PVT focuses on wear, erosion, and corrosion-resistant, low-friction, high-performance thin films and coatings. They develop vacuum coating processes and protective coatings and design and manufacture vacuum coating systems, including batch-type and continuous in-line systems. PVT offers turnkey solutions, including facility layout, after-sales training, system upgrades, and job coating services. They also provide cleaning lines and quality control test equipment. PVT serves various industries, including cutting tools, dies and molds, automotive, aerospace, and medical. Their product offerings include hard coatings (Ti-based, Cr-based, AlTi-based, AlCr-based, Si-doped) and DLC coatings. They also offer systems like xPro series and i-L series. PVT is also involved in H2 technology, developing in-line coating systems for fuel cells. The company emphasizes customer satisfaction and continuous improvement in coating processes and system design.

description: Polycheck Diagnostics, a brand of Biocheck GmbH, is a German company specializing in in vitro diagnostic kits for human and veterinary serum diagnostics. Their Polycheck system offers multiparameter immunoassays for the quantitative determination of allergen-specific immunoglobulins E (IgEs) or autoimmune disease-related immunoglobulins G and A (IgGs and IgAs) in blood samples. These kits are designed as single-use screening tests for professional medical users, aiding in the detection of sensitization against allergens or auto-antigens that may indicate clinical allergies or autoimmune disorders. Polycheck provides product lines for autoimmune, allergy, and veterinary diagnostics. The testing system involves taking a blood sample, pipetting serum onto cassettes with allergen or antigen membranes, incubating, proceeding with the assay using special reagents, and evaluating the results using Biocheck Imaging Software and a flatbed scanner. They also offer a fully automated solution for high throughput testing. The company is certified according to EN ISO 13485:2016 and is looking for distributors for their Polycheck Diagnostic kits.

description: The City Science Lab at HafenCity University Hamburg (HCU) researches the transformation of cities in the context of digitalization. They apply a transformative research approach to the topic of Digital Cities, analyzing urban challenges and developing innovative solutions for sustainable urban living. Their goal is to facilitate the transformative power of cities in shaping global change. They develop digital tools with local and global partners, applied in virtual and urban spaces, to capture and make complexities comprehensible for various target groups. The United Nations Sustainable Development Goals guide their work. They use data-based technologies to strengthen urban resilience, aiming for adaptable, climate-neutral, and liveable cities. They also develop innovative governance tools for understanding, modeling, and collaboratively steering complex urban systems. They cooperate with experts from civil society, politics, economics, administration, and science, engaging in data-based exchange with informed partners, questioning power relations, and including marginalized groups. They promote citizen inclusion and media literacy in digital political decision-making, considering citizens as sovereign project partners. They advocate for transparent disclosure of urban data while emphasizing ethical approaches to personal data and data protection. They integrate artistic practices, creating mixed realities and physical/virtual spaces, focusing on design and aesthetics to inspire action and generate practical knowledge. Key projects include Cockpit Social Infrastructure (CoSI), The UN Innovation and Technology Accelerator for Cities (UNITAC Hamburg), Finding Places, and Connected Urban Twins. They collaborate with the MIT Media Lab's City Science group and are part of the City Science Network, an international community focused on livable, equitable, and resilient communities. They also partner with UNITAC Hamburg, ahoi.digital (the Alliance of Hamburg Universities for Computer Science), and mint:pink (a network to spark interest in STEM for female high school students). They collaborate with academia, the public sector, and businesses in Hamburg to enhance sustainability, integrated into the “Digital Strategy” of the City of Hamburg.

description: The Stiftung Entwicklungs-Zusammenarbeit Baden-Württemberg (SEZ) is a foundation based in Baden-Württemberg, Germany, that promotes globally responsible action. Founded in 1991, the SEZ supports projects aimed at fostering a more just world. It offers educational programs and exchange formats to raise awareness in Baden-Württemberg about the impact of local actions on global issues. Through networking and project funding, including the 'bwirkt!' funding line, the SEZ supports private, municipal, and regional initiatives focused on partnerships, particularly those involving young people and migrant/diasporic actors, with projects in Baden-Württemberg, abroad, and in Burundi. A key initiative is the AMAHORO! state partnership between Baden-Württemberg and Burundi, which has been connecting the two regions for over 40 years. The SEZ provides platforms for dialogue, education, and information exchange, aiming to facilitate collaborative solutions for a more sustainable and equitable world. It emphasizes intercultural sensitivity, respect, and transparency in its partnerships, viewing diversity as essential for global justice. The SEZ is involved in various projects including Fair Handeln, Fairtrade-Schools-Kampagne, BW Future Fashion, and Mindchangers.

description: roXtra is a software solution designed for digital quality management (QM). It aims to simplify QM processes across various norms and industries by providing a paperless and efficient system. The software offers modular solutions for integrated management systems, including document control, process management, risk management, audit management, and measures management. It caters to a wide range of industries, including healthcare (hospitals, clinics, medical centers, nursing care), medicine and pharma (pharmacies, laboratories, drug manufacturers, medical device manufacturers), industry and services, food, education, public institutions, and social services. roXtra supports various norms such as ISO 9001 and ISO 13485, and offers features like an electronic QM manual, process documentation, a configurable workflow, audittrail, and full-text search. The software facilitates knowledge management, transparent teamwork, and system-wide data access. It also supports the implementation of integrated management systems (IMS) encompassing quality management (ISO 9001), environmental management (ISO 14001), energy management (ISO 50001), and occupational safety (ISO 45001), as well as compliance with GDPR and other guidelines. roXtra offers user management features with customizable access rights and integration with identity providers. The software assists in building a digital QM manual and managing documents throughout their lifecycle, supporting ISO certification. description: Wildner Akademie für digitale Wirtschaft & Management, founded in 1992, is a German academy focused on providing further education and training in the fields of digital economy and management. They offer a range of geförderte Weiterbildungen (funded training programs) covering topics such as graphics, video, marketing, AI, social media, web publishing, 3D, and copywriting. The academy targets individuals seeking to update or expand their skills for career advancement or re-entry into the workforce. The academy utilizes online live instruction with lecturers, provides software and hardware, and emphasizes intensive project work. They claim a high placement rate (90%) for their graduates. Wildner Akademie also offers themenspezifische Tagesseminare (thematic day seminars) and individualized training solutions tailored to specific needs. They emphasize digital learning literacy and incorporate KI-Skills (AI skills) into all Weiterbildungen. The Wildner AG, the parent company, is recognized as an Exzellenzbetrieb (excellence company) by DDW (Die Deutsche Wirtschaft). The academy has bundesweite Standorte (nationwide locations) and also offers Live-Video-Unterricht (live video instruction). The Wildner Education Group has a strategic participation with Karlshochschule International University. Klaus Wolfgang Wildner founded the company in 1992 and is Vorstand (CEO) of Wildner AG. The academy aims to equip customers for the challenges of digital transformation and ensure they acquire digital competencies.

description: Ahlberg Metalltechnik GmbH, founded in 2004 and based in Berlin, is a medium-sized, owner-managed company specializing in metal technology and engineering services. The company operates through two divisions: Ahlberg Metalltechnik GmbH (AM), which focuses on series production of punching, bending, turning, milling parts, and welding assemblies, and Ahlberg Engineering GmbH (AE), a wholly-owned subsidiary, which handles engineering services such as development, simulation, design, automation, tool making, and fixture construction. AE provides services including machine design (housings, sound insulation), FEM and CFD simulations, and automation of assembly and welding equipment. They also create design documents, spare parts catalogs, and operating instructions. Ahlberg Metalltechnik manufactures complex progressive tools, punching and bending tools, clamping, assembly, welding, and testing devices, and semi-automatic and fully automated production lines. They utilize CNC milling, turning, EDM, grinding, and laser technology. Their services cater to various industries, including automotive (OEMs like Mercedes-Benz, AMG, Nissan, Renault, and suppliers like Valmet, Bosch, ZF, SKF, Nidec GPM), mechanical engineering (Alfred Raith, Baumer, Hübner, TRUMPF), building industry (Schüco, Häfele), railway industry (Knorr Bremse), motorcycle industry (BMW Motorrad), and energy industry (EBK, Siemens). The company holds ISO 9001:2015 certification. They emphasize social responsibility, offering family-friendly working conditions, training young people, and employing refugees and the long-term unemployed. They sponsor local sports clubs and are involved in initiatives supporting refugees and addressing historical injustices.

description: MedTec Medizintechnik GmbH, established in 1998, is a global market leader specializing in therapeutic MBST (Magnetic Resonance Therapy) Kernspinresonanz technology. The company's core business revolves around developing and distributing MBST therapy systems for human, veterinary, and aesthetic medicine. These systems are used worldwide and are based on numerous international patents. The MBST Kernspinresonanz-Therapie is applied in various settings, including outpatient, inpatient, preventative, postoperative, and rehabilitative care. It is primarily used for degenerative diseases of the musculoskeletal system, such as arthrosis, osteoporosis, and disc damage, as well as other conditions and injuries affecting biological tissues. The therapy is non-invasive, non-pharmaceutical, and has reportedly shown no known side effects or interactions in over 20 years of use. MedTec's mission is to better understand the causes of degenerative diseases through research and to treat them effectively with MBST therapy in a non-invasive, gentle, sustainable, and side-effect-free manner. The company offers a range of MBST therapy devices, including ARTHRO·SPIN·FLEX, ARTHRO·SPIN·LIFT, OSTEO·SPIN, OPEN·SYSTEM·700, OPEN·SYSTEM·350, OSTEO·SYSTEM, CLOSED·SYSTEM·600, CLOSED·SYSTEM·300, and PRO·MOBIL. They also provide patient information and resources related to conditions like arthrosis, osteoporosis, disc problems, sports injuries, pain, and wound healing. The company targets doctors, specialists, medical centers, hospitals, clinics, and universities globally. The business model involves selling MBST therapy systems and providing related services and training through the MBST ACADEMY.

description: Velamed GmbH, founded in 2005 and based in Cologne, Germany, is a European distributor of biomechanical measurement systems. They offer a modular and expandable system concept, integrating various systems with central software. Velamed also provides professional training and knowledge transfer in all areas of biomechanics and system applications, including EMG, inertial sensor technology, and gait and video analysis. They aim to offer technical innovation driven by customer needs, maintaining a network between customers and manufacturers.

description: PL BioScience GmbH is a biotechnology company that develops and manufactures Human Platelet Lysate (HPL) products for cell culture applications. Their primary offering is the ELAREM™ platform, a range of human platelet lysates designed as xeno-free alternatives to Fetal Bovine Serum (FBS) for cell expansion and culture. The company targets academic research, diagnostics, and regenerative medicine, including stem cell therapy development. Their products are available in research grade, GMP grade, and GMP-Clinical grade to meet varying safety and regulatory requirements. PL BioScience offers a variety of HPL products, including ELAREM™ Prime, ELAREM™ Perform, and ELAREM™ Ultimate, each with different features such as fibrinogen-depletion, virus inactivation, and suitability for 2D and 3D cell culture. They also offer the ELAREM™ Matrix Kit, a hydrogel for 3D cell cultivation. The company emphasizes the affordability, safety, and efficiency of their HPL products, highlighting their ability to simulate the natural cell environment for optimal growth results. PL BioScience aims to bridge the gap between academic research and clinical applications by providing advanced cell culture solutions. They are based in Aachen, Germany, and manufacture their products from platelets obtained from healthy blood donors at licensed blood centers in the EU and US. Their mission is to promote the change from Fetal Bovine Serum to safe and ethically acceptable cell culture solutions.

description: SphingoTec GmbH is a German company focused on developing innovative biomarkers for the diagnosis, prediction, and monitoring of acute medical conditions. Their biomarkers target diagnostically underserved areas in critical care, such as acute kidney injury (AKI), sepsis, and acute heart failure. The company offers biomarker assays for research use and collaborates with IVD and pharma companies to make IVD products available for clinical diagnostics worldwide. SphingoTec's product offerings include proprietary biomarker assays developed in-house, utilizing their exclusive biomarkers and scientific expertise, and IVD assays of their partners, which are certified license assays developed by trusted partners who have in-licensed their biomarker technology. Key biomarkers include Proenkephalin A 119-159 (penKid), a kidney function biomarker, and bioactive Adrenomedullin 1-52 (bio-ADM), an endothelial function biomarker. SphingoTec partners with global IVD companies for broad market adoption of their biomarkers and collaborates with pharma companies to provide solutions for enrichment and increased efficacy strategies in critical care drug discovery. Their assays are based on chemiluminescence sandwich immunoassay technology and are available in microtiter plate format for research purposes. The company aims to bridge science and patient care for acute challenges by developing innovative biomarkers to support early intervention and personalized medicine in critical care.

description: EKF is a German manufacturer of modular industrial microcomputers, established in 1972. They design and manufacture embedded boards and systems for industries including industrial automation, railway and public transportation, avionics and space, telecom and power, automotive, medical, and extreme environments. EKF offers standard products and customized solutions based on CPU and communication technologies. Their product range includes CompactPCI Serial, Embedded Blue/Gold series (available as Industrial PCs or board-level modules), and ModBlox7 (modular industrial PCs). EKF's products are designed for harsh environments. They emphasize fast project implementation, long product life cycles, and high quality. EKF is involved in PICMG standardization and offers solutions like CPU cards, peripheral boards, housings, and systems. They also offer cloud integration options for centralized management and updates. EKF is certified to ISO-9001 since 1996 and has in-house development and SMT manufacturing at its headquarters in Hamm, Germany.

IPC's core competencies include drying, agglomeration, spray granulation, pelletizing, encapsulation, and coating. The company focuses on providing a wide selection of natural stone in top quality, along with quartz stone and ceramic panels for custom-made products. They have a long tradition of manufacturing and custom-making stone washbasins, window sills, and stairs from concrete block stone, and later terrazzo flooring. They have since expanded their focus to include tiles and natural stone for both interior and exterior applications.

description:
The GGP-Gruppe is a German organization providing comprehensive medical, social, pedagogical, and rehabilitative services. Their services cater to a wide range of demographics, including children, adolescents, adults, and families. They operate various facilities such as daycare centers (Kindertagesstätten), therapeutic shared living communities (Wohngemeinschaften) for children and adolescents, and facilities for adults requiring assisted living and integration support. Their offerings include: 

*   **Childcare and Education:** Multiple daycare centers and after-school programs (Hort) with flexible care options.
*   **Support for Children, Adolescents, and Families:** Outpatient (Ambulant) and inpatient (Tagesklinik) services, including pediatric psychiatry, psychotherapy, occupational therapy (Ergotherapie), speech therapy (Logopädie), inclusion support, early intervention, and family support.
*   **Nursing Care (Pflegerische Versorgung):** Inpatient psychiatric care facilities and outpatient services, including household services, assisted living, social therapy, and psychiatric nursing.
*   **Integration Services (Teilhabeleistungen) for Adults:** Assisted living, shared living arrangements, emergency shelter, and day structure programs aimed at social and vocational reintegration.
*   **Medicine and Therapy for Adults:** Outpatient and day clinic services, including geriatric psychiatry, occupational therapy, speech therapy, and rehabilitation for the mentally ill.
*   **Addiction Support (Sucht):** "Die Pilzmanufaktur" which seems to be a project related to addiction support, possibly involving cultivation of mushrooms.

The GGP-Gruppe also emphasizes partnerships with various organizations, including the Volkstheater Rostock, Universität Rostock, and other social service providers. They offer career opportunities and promote social responsibility. The organization also provides support groups for relatives of individuals affected by sexualized violence and eating disorders.

Their core focus is on automating and standardizing global end-to-end container import processes. The platform offers various modules including Container Release, Container Drop-off Change, Container Reuse, Container Pick-up Change, C/H Instructions, and a Dem, Det & Storage Calculator. Flowfox aims to reduce delays and costs associated with manual import processes, missing data, security vulnerabilities, local integrations, claims, and disputes. Flowfox emphasizes standardization of local container import processes, leveraging DCSA standards and abstracting local variations to create a consistent and automated experience, particularly for shipping company customers. The company's stated goal is to become the industry standard for container releases and help carriers generate additional revenue through their platform. They cater to both ocean carriers and forwarders/BCOs, offering benefits such as reduced delays and cost savings per import container.

description: celsius37.com AG is a provider of a specialized Oncology Information System, founded in 2000. They digitalize oncological care with structured processes and certified quality, supporting hospitals, clinic networks, and physician networks in documentation, certification, and interdisciplinary collaboration. Their platform is modular, integrated, and cross-sectoral. description: Gerweck GmbH is a German company specializing in surface technology, specifically galvanic and metal plating solutions. They cater to a wide range of industries including automotive, e-mobility, medical technology, and telecommunications. Gerweck offers both reel-to-reel and single-part electroplating services, emphasizing high quality standards and customer satisfaction. They support customers from prototype development to series production, utilizing state-of-the-art prototype systems and focusing on technological system development and automation with the latest analysis methods. For single-part electroplating, they employ barrel, Vibrobot, and rack technologies to process various part sizes and complexities. Special methods include selective plating of foils and prototype electroplating. description: Iris Biotech GmbH, founded in 2001, supplies innovative and rare compounds, along with standard reagents, to scientists in industry and academia worldwide. The company focuses on peptide chemistry, while also offering expertise in drug delivery, life sciences, and linkerology. To meet the demand for customized solutions, Iris Biotech expanded its custom synthesis capabilities in 2013, offering expertise in manufacturing both simple and complex molecules. Their product catalog includes amino acids, building blocks, reagents, resins, and products for click chemistry, drug delivery, and life sciences. They offer a range of amino acids, including standard, non-standard, and functionalized derivatives. Their building blocks include amino derivatives, cyclic compounds, dipeptides, and fatty acid derivatives. Drug delivery products range from PEGs to poly-amino acids and fullerenes. Click chemistry products include various clickable building blocks for in vitro and in vivo applications. Linkerology® products include various linkers for chemoimmuno-conjugates. Reagents include solvents, scavengers, coupling reagents, and protecting groups. Resins include a wide selection of functionalized resins for solid-phase synthesis. The company also offers custom synthesis services for products not listed in their portfolio. Iris Biotech's mission is "Empowering Peptide Innovation," aiming to support customers in their projects as a qualified supplier and competent advisor from research to commercial production. The company participates in conferences and symposia to stay in contact with researchers and scientists and to gather new ideas for future challenges.

description: La Red is a German association based in Berlin focused on supporting migrants with their arrival and integration into German society, particularly concerning fair labor market integration for migrants from the EU and third countries. Their activities and projects cover various aspects relevant to the integration of newcomers. La Red's work is divided into three main areas: (1) Counseling & vocational guidance, including recognition counseling for foreign professional qualifications, job search support, and general labor and social law advice, especially for individuals in difficult situations, as well as vocational orientation and coaching. (2) Networking & collaboration, which involves facilitating connections between migrants and companies, supporting SMEs in recruiting skilled workers, and conducting workshops for employers and employees on intercultural competence and diversity in the workplace. (3) Social participation & innovation, focusing on democratic and social participation, strengthening digital and AI skills for migrant communities, political education, and combating right-wing extremism, racism, and group-related misanthropy in social media. La Red acts as a bridge between migrants, companies, labor market actors, and society to promote equal opportunities and sustainable integration. They offer various programs and consulting services to facilitate access to work, qualification, and professional recognition for people with international backgrounds.

description: The Sächsische Landesärztekammer is the public professional representation for doctors in the Free State of Saxony. Based on the Heilberufekammergesetz (Chamber of Healing Professions Act), it is authorized to regulate its professional, professional-political and professional-legal affairs itself. It is a corporation under public law. According to the subsidiarity principle, it performs legitimate public tasks in the fulfillment of which there is an increased interest of society, but which can neither be effectively performed solely through private initiative nor belong to the state tasks in the narrower sense, which the state itself must perform through its authorities. The state makes use of the help of self-governing institutions in the fulfillment of public tasks, which it allows to form itself from the respective subject area, and which, through their expertise, help to create the basis for state resolutions in this area to gain the highest possible degree of proximity to the subject matter and correctness. This is not a pure representation of interests, as professional associations perceive it, but the perception of the professional interests of all doctors, taking into account the welfare of the general public. The fulfillment of administrative tasks in the health care system by the chambers is closer to the subject matter - and, because of the participation of those affected by self-elected bodies, also more freedom-securing - than by state authorities. The value of the proposals and expert opinions developed by the chambers is based, in addition to the independence of their judgment, on the completeness of the overview that the chambers possess in the area of the conditions to be assessed. From this point of view, the representation of interests by private associations is not oriented to the same extent towards the overall interest and the common good.
match_reasoning: Zielgruppe: Ärzte (für Beratung und Schulung zu medizinischem Cannabis); Bezug zum Gesundheitswesen durch digitale Lösungen für Apotheken und Ärzte

description: Die Deutsche Akademie für Public Relations (dapr) ist eine Akademie für Ausbildung, Weiterbildung und Prüfung in der deutschen Kommunikationsbranche. Seit 1991 vermittelt die dapr Know-how in Kommunikationsmanagement, Unternehmenskommunikation, Public Relations (PR), Öffentlichkeitsarbeit und Marketingkommunikation. Das Angebot richtet sich an Lernende und Unternehmen. Für Kommunikatoren aller Erfahrungslevel werden berufsbegleitende Weiterbildungen angeboten, die praxisorientiertes und theoretisch fundiertes Wissen in interner und externer Kommunikation, Digitalstrategie, KI und Social Media, Public Affairs, Marketingkommunikation, Nachhaltigkeitskommunikation und Employer Branding vermitteln. Die dapr bietet Seminare, Inhouse-Seminare, Prüfungen und Zertifizierungen an. Die Prüfungen führen zu anerkannten dapr-Titeln in verschiedenen Disziplinen der Kommunikation, wie Kommunikationsberater*in (dapr), Kommunikationsreferent*in (dapr), Berater*in/Referent*in Interne Kommunikation und Change (dapr), Digital Strategist (dapr) und Expert*in Nachhaltigkeits-Kommunikation (dapr). Die Zertifizierung von Volontariaten und Traineeprogrammen in Kommunikation und PR ist einmalig in Deutschland. Die dapr bietet auch Struktur- und Prozessberatung für Kommunikationsabteilungen mit Fokus auf Kompetenzen an. Die dapr garantiert Qualität, Zufriedenheit, eine gesunde Gruppengröße und eine angenehme Seminaratmosphäre.

Their business model is based on an indirect white-label system, enabling partners to build their business using nexxtra's infrastructure and services.

description: ChemiLytics is a German analytical laboratory that is part of the Mitsubishi Materials Group. ChemiLytics serves global customers in industries such as 3D printing, aerospace, and e-mobility. ChemiLytics supports customers throughout the entire closed-loop process with individual analytical solutions, specifically in battery recycling, additive manufacturing, and general recycling. The company emphasizes quality, experience, customer orientation, and the use of advanced technology to deliver high-quality results.
